Description: Rim and body sherd (with added plaster) of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved wth painted inscription.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd belongs to the same vase as Oxford AN1896-1908-G.141.40b. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two concentric white bands (Williams 1983, 169). Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 170, no. 220)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1887) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
